column1: Smoque BBQ////When I got home and ate my meal
column2: it was all I could have asked for
column3: and more. The meat was perfectly tender. If you want sauce on your brisket you'll have to pour it on
column4: because it's too tender to dip. The slow-cooked brisket tasted similar to that my grandma used to make. I really enjoyed it. I tried a piece of the pulled pork sandwich
column7: was really tasty. I like that they put the sauce on the side. I'm a dipper
column9: but the meat is just as delicious without it. The entree also came with a side of slaw which is vinegar based and made with fresh cabbage.
